title: 820-00840 Stuck on 5V
message: Hello. Got an 820-00840 that was negotiating 19V with charger but drawing just 0.02A. During measuring I slipped the probe of the multimeter and burned the PP3V3_G3H_VR circuitry and no 19V anymore obviously. I managed to fix the 3V3 circuit and board is giving 3.3V again but still no 19V. On USBXCA I get steady 5.1V, 0.03A. On USBCXB I also get 5.1V 0.03 amps but it keeps resetting my charger. I thought maybe U3200 was dead and replaced it, still same behavior. Verified all caps around U3200 and U3100 and there are no shorts. Any ideas?

title: 820-00840 Stuck on 5V
message:
Compare diode mode readings on LDO rails of both CD3215 chips.
When you slipped the probe multimeter, did you accidentally inject high voltage into 3V3_G3H rail?

title: 820-00840 Stuck on 5V
message: Probably. It’s been days ago I did it. I was waiting for stencil to arrive to replace CD3215 from donor board as I did have good CD3215 and did not have the stencil for it. I’ll diode mode and post back

title: 820-00840 Stuck on 5V
message:
PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO - 0.172
PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO - 0.475(strange!)

this is the only LDO line that is giving inconsistency between U3100 and U3200

title: 820-00840 Stuck on 5V
message:
Change U3100, as first suspect.
If still the same, follow that power rail; be aware, it changes the name few times.

title: 820-00840 Stuck on 5V
message: Replaced U3100 and got 19V back, but 0 amps drawing. What's next?

title: 820-00840 Stuck on 5V
message: PPBUS_G3H stable at 13v. Still no current draw

title: 820-00840 Stuck on 5V
message: Do you get 3V3_S5/SUS?

title: 820-00840 Stuck on 5V
message: No 3V3_S5... 0V there!

title: 820-00840 Stuck on 5V
message: Check basic voltages and signals for U7800 (7 OF 10), page 60.

title: 820-00840 Stuck on 5V
message: Hello. What exactly would be those "basic signals"?

title: 820-00840 Stuck on 5V
message:
The very basic ones, to wake up the PMIC; VINLDO3, LDO3V/5V, VREF1V25.
Also check SHUTDOWN*, ACOK and V3P3A_RTC.

title: 820-00840 Stuck on 5V
message:
VINLDO3 = 13V
PP3V3_LDO3V = 3.3V
PP5V_LDO5V - 5V
VREF1V25 - 1.248V
PMIC_SHUTDOWN_L = 3.345V
SMC_PM_G2_EN = 3.41V
PP3V1_RTC = 3.088V

As all signals appear to be OK, I assumed PMIC was bad and replaced it from a donor board, but still same! There's a chance the other board got a bad PMIC too though...

title: 820-00840 Stuck on 5V
message: Post U7890 voltages.

title: 820-00840 Stuck on 5V
message:
PIN 1 - goes from 0V up to 1.5V, dies and goes up to 1.5V again in loop
PIN 2 - 0V
PIN 3 - 0V
PIN 4 - 0V
PIN 6 - 3.3V

title: 820-00840 Stuck on 5V
message:
No pulse at all at PMIC_EN_P3V3S5 at all?
Be sure R7883 is good.

title: 820-00840 Stuck on 5V
message: I think it's giving a pulse yes, but my multimeter is not so fast to catch it properly. I notice a little variation on voltage though... R7883 is good.

title: 820-00840 Stuck on 5V
message:
You should note the pulse at pin 4/U7890 too.
An o-scope can help, it catches the peak of any fast pulse.

title: 820-00840 Stuck on 5V
message: I'm measuring on Pin 1 of R7890 because U7890 is BGA. It seems to pulse. I leave the multimeter probe on R7890 with charger disconnected and it stays steady on 0.00V. When I plug in the charger and it negotiates 20V with the board I get a peak of around 150mV for a fraction of second and it comes back to 0.00V again on my multimeter. I do not have oscilloscope here, so cannot measure it precisely. But it seems to pulse.

title: 820-00840 Stuck on 5V
message:
Check for pulse at R7662.
If you are not sure, remove it and check at its pad 1.

title: 820-00840 Stuck on 5V
message: It pulses to around 100mV. I'm sure it pulses now

title: 820-00840 Stuck on 5V
message:
Remove R7662 and bring 3v3_G3H to P3V3S5_EN.
See if you get stable 3V3_S5.

title: 820-00840 Stuck on 5V
message: I jumped 3v3 to Pin 1 of R7662 and still 0V on 3V3_S5

title: 820-00840 Stuck on 5V
message: I've said to run the wire to pad 2!

title: 820-00840 Stuck on 5V
message: Sorry, my mistake on typing. Was on Pin 2

title: 820-00840 Stuck on 5V
message:
Remove R7660/61/62 and bring 3V3_G3H to pad 2 of all them.
Then check voltage at L7520/60.

title: 820-00840 Stuck on 5V
message: Did it. Still no 3V3_S5

title: 820-00840 Stuck on 5V
message: Keep the mod and post U7650 voltages; pins 23, 12, 13, 22, 29, 21, 4.

title: 820-00840 Stuck on 5V
message:
Looks like bad U7501.
Post first diode mode to ground at pins 13, 22, 29.
Also for L7520/60.

title: 820-00840 Stuck on 5V
message:
I think you had mistaken something. You mean U7650 right? And L7670 and L7690. If so, here it goes:

U7650
Pin 13 - 0.451
Pin 22 - 0.022
Pin 29 - 0.405

L7670 - 0.360
L7690 - 0.335

When I started measuring I found that L7670 was shorted to GND somehow(it was not before), so I went ahead and injected voltage in it and C3000 boiled. I removed it, short gone. So I removed the jumper wire from the board and replaced U7650 and went ahead on diode mode to measure what you asked. Those are the results, but still no power and no 3.3_S5 nor any voltage on L7670

title: 820-00840 Stuck on 5V
message:
Right, I was thinking about 00165 board.

"Pin 22 - 0.022"
Not good; replace C7653 and check again.

title: 820-00840 Stuck on 5V
message: 0.490 now after replacing cap... It's better now as I'm getting steady 3.3V on L7690, still no voltage on L7670 though...

title: 820-00840 Stuck on 5V
message: Did you check L7670 voltage with the above mod applied?

title: 820-00840 Stuck on 5V
message: Will check tomorrow and post back

title: 820-00840 Stuck on 5V
message: Hello! Did the mod again. Now I get steady 5V on L7670, still no power!

title: 820-00840 Stuck on 5V
message:
So you know U7650 area is good.
Now put back all resistors and remove the wires.

In normal mode, do you get 3V3_S5 now?

title: 820-00840 Stuck on 5V
message: Yes I do

title: 820-00840 Stuck on 5V
message: Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L and check for pulse at L7670, at same time.

title: 820-00840 Stuck on 5V
message: Did it. No pulsing at all!

title: 820-00840 Stuck on 5V
message:
Any pulse at PM_SLP_S4_L, or drop pulse at PM_PWRBTN_L at least?
PM_RSMRST_L is high?

title: 820-00840 Stuck on 5V
message:
PM_SLP_S4_L no pulse
PM_RSMRST_L 0V
PM_PWRBTN_L Stays steady 3.3V when charger negotiates 20V with the board

title: 820-00840 Stuck on 5V
message:
If U7800 keeps PMIC_RSMRST_L down, PCH cannot react.
PM_PGOOD_P3V3S5 is present?

title: 820-00840 Stuck on 5V
message: PM_PGOOD_P3V3S5 not present on Pin1 of R7903, if I measure on Pin 20 of U7650 it's pulsing.

title: 820-00840 Stuck on 5V
message: Now PP3V3_S5 started pulsing also! WTF

title: 820-00840 Stuck on 5V
message:
Re-check solders and traces near U7650.
Test the board alone on the desk.
PPBUS_G3H is steady now?

title: 820-00840 Stuck on 5V
message: Solder/traces are all ok. PPBUS_G3H steady 13V

title: 820-00840 Stuck on 5V
message: Try now to start in SMC bypass mode.

title: 820-00840 Stuck on 5V
message: No luck. PPBUS_G3H is stable, but PP3V3_S5 is pulsing like hell, in and out the case.

title: 820-00840 Stuck on 5V
message:
Do again the previous mode.
SMC_PM_G2_EN is stable?

title: 820-00840 Stuck on 5V
message: SMC_PM_G2_EN pulsing like roller coaster

title: 820-00840 Stuck on 5V
message:
Looks like SMC detects some problem and cycles power sequence.

BTW, did you check it with that mode applied?

title: 820-00840 Stuck on 5V
message: You mean in SMC bypass?

title: 820-00840 Stuck on 5V
message:
NO; as you've said already tried.
I mean to check if SMC_PM_G2_EN still fluctuates with the enable mod applied on U7650.
Try another 87W original charger also.

title: 820-00840 Stuck on 5V
message: Gave up on this one. Costumer picked the machine up today as no repair. Thanks for all the help anyway.
